repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Fixes #3796

*Note: I have not been able to find where to put the tests for the parsing and generating the code :sweat_smile:. If someone puts me in the right direction, will make sure to do them*

comment_data.body:
a) "NOne" -> None
b) Maybe a clearer name (or at least a clearer comment) - `self_documenting_text`?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3340,14 +3340,16 @@ class FormattedValueNode(ExprNode):
     # {}-delimited portions of an f-string
     #
     # value           ExprNode                The expression itself
-    # conversion_char str or None             Type conversion (!s, !r, !a, or none, or 'd' for integer conversion)
+    # conversion_char str or None             Type conversion (!s, !r, !a, none, or 'd' for integer conversion)
     # format_spec     JoinedStrNode or None   Format string passed to __format__
+    # expr_text       str or NOne             If not None, the expression text

comment_data.body: Will fix that `None` and fix the comment :+1:
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3340,14 +3340,16 @@ class FormattedValueNode(ExprNode):
     # {}-delimited portions of an f-string
     #
     # value           ExprNode                The expression itself
-    # conversion_char str or None             Type conversion (!s, !r, !a, or none, or 'd' for integer conversion)
+    # conversion_char str or None             Type conversion (!s, !r, !a, none, or 'd' for integer conversion)
     # format_spec     JoinedStrNode or None   Format string passed to __format__
+    # expr_text       str or NOne             If not None, the expression text

comment_data.body:
I'm pretty sure this is leaking the result of `PyUnicode_FromStringAndSize`, and probably the result of `PyNumber_Add` too.

I think this might have to be a new section in `Cython/Utility/Stringtools.c` similar to `PyObjectFormatAndDecref` etc. But this is the first time I've looked at the fstring implementation so I'm not complete confident about the best way to do it.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3420,6 +3422,13 @@ def generate_result_code(self, code):
             code.globalstate.use_utility_code(
                 UtilityCode.load_cached("PyObjectFormatSimple", "StringTools.c"))
 
+        if self.expr_text:
+            expr_text = self.expr_text + '='
+            value_result = 'PyNumber_Add(PyUnicode_FromStringAndSize("%s", %s), %s)' % (

comment_data.body:
An alternative approach that might be worth a go is to generate a different set of nodes (probably at the `analyse_ expressions` stage). Something like:

```
# in analyse_expressions for FormattedValueNode:
if self.expr_text:
    return AddNode(self.pos, lhs=StringConstantNode(self.pos, value=self.expr_text+"="),
                                       rhs=<copy of self but without self.expr_text>).analyse_expressions(env)
```

The advantage of doing something like that is that Cython's code generation should take care of most of the details. Note that the code above is a very vague outline...
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3420,6 +3422,13 @@ def generate_result_code(self, code):
             code.globalstate.use_utility_code(
                 UtilityCode.load_cached("PyObjectFormatSimple", "StringTools.c"))
 
+        if self.expr_text:
+            expr_text = self.expr_text + '='
+            value_result = 'PyNumber_Add(PyUnicode_FromStringAndSize("%s", %s), %s)' % (

comment_data.body:
Will have a try with that approach :+1: 

Btw, mind canceling all the old builds? They are taking for ever to complete:
https://travis-ci.org/github/cython/cython/builds/748578596
https://travis-ci.org/github/cython/cython/builds/748556005

Thanks again!
